title: Black bean & corn soup with cornbread fritters

ingredients.item: 1 bunch salad onions (white and green parts)
400g can black beans in water, drained
1 red chilli, deseeded and finely chopped
4 tbsp natural low fat yogurt, to garnish

instructions.step: Heat 1 tsp oil in a large saucepan. Chop the salad onions (reserving 2 tbsp to garnish) and cook over a medium-high heat for 2-3 minutes, stirring until golden. Add the cumin and 3 tsp coriander and stir for a minute. Add the beans, corn and passata. Half-fill the passata bottle with water, swirl and add the water to the pan. Bring to a simmer and cook gently for 10-15 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a bowl whisk together the polenta, flour, bicarbonate of soda, chilli, the remaining coriander and 175ml warm water. Leave for 10 minutes to thicken slightly.
Brush a non-stick frying pan with some of the remaining oil. Add 1 tbsp dollops to the pan, 2cm apart. Cook for 2 minutes each side over a medium heat until deep golden. Repeat to make 8.
Garnish the soup with the remaining salad onions, avocado, yogurt and a squeeze of lime. Serve with the fritters.
